messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

On Wed, Sep 28, 2011 at 19:32, <r@golang.org> wrote:

> i find these quotes distracting. why not "." or just . ?


the reason not to do "." is that godoc typesets `` and '' as
real quotation marks, just like troff does.
i can just drop them.

On Wed, Sep 28, 2011 at 19:32, <r@golang.org> wrote:

> http://codereview.appspot.com/**5141051/diff/2001/src/cmd/go/**
> vet.go#newcode20<http://codereview.appspot.com/5141051/diff/2001/src/cmd/go/vet.go#newcode20>
> src/cmd/go/vet.go:20: `,
> is this tab right?
>

i call strings.TrimSpace on the strings so that i can use
spaces on the ends to make things look more like
a normal struct definition.

LGTM but some comments wouldn't go wrong

http://codereview.appspot.com/5141051/diff/2001/src/cmd/go/doc.go
File src/cmd/go/doc.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5141051/diff/2001/src/cmd/go/doc.go#newcode14
src/cmd/go/doc.go:14: with a ``.'' or ``..'' element is interpreted as a local
i find these quotes distracting. why not "." or just . ?

http://codereview.appspot.com/5141051/diff/2001/src/cmd/go/main.go
File src/cmd/go/main.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5141051/diff/2001/src/cmd/go/main.go#newcode16
src/cmd/go/main.go:16: type Command struct {
how about some comments? there are almost none.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5141051/diff/2001/src/cmd/go/vet.go
File src/cmd/go/vet.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5141051/diff/2001/src/cmd/go/vet.go#newcode20
src/cmd/go/vet.go:20: `,
is this tab right?

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=7ae32f195afd ***

go: skeleton implementation

R=golang-dev, bradfitz, r
CC=golang-dev
